Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to Resident Ratio
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two youth have been in a sexual relationship for the past few
months at the facility. The encounters take place in one of the
youth's room.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor 1/ Complaint Source was interviewed face to face at
the facility on January 8, 2024. Supervisor 1 reported there were
rumors of Youth A and Youth B having sexual intercourse with one
another at the facility. He reported Staff 1 reported that he heard
rumors that there were also inappropriate text messages between
the two youth. Supervisor 1 reported he has never heard or seen
anything inappropriate between Youth A and Youth B. He reported
neither of the youth have shared rooms with one another or been on
safety plans due to sexualized behaviors. Supervisor 1 reported
youth are allowed to have cell phones at the facility. He reported staff
conduct frequent room checks and the youth are allowed to be in
each other rooms, but the door needs to be cracked. If a youth
refuses to crack the door, then staff are to stand in the doorway to
maintain supervision.
2

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 8,
2024. Youth A reported things are going well at the facility and noted
he is not in the home a lot as he is out working. Youth A reported the
gets frustrated with the other youth at times because they make fun
of Youth B and Youth C for having different sexual preferences. He
reported he has never heard of any youth having sex at the facility
and denied ever having sex at the facility. Youth A reported no one
has ever touched him inappropriately at the facility. He reported
youth are allowed to visit in each other’s rooms, but the door needs
to be open. Youth A reported staff are always doing room checks. He
stated if he felt uncomfortable or someone touched him
inappropriately, he would report it to a staff. Youth A reported he
does have a cell phone as well and uses it to communicate with his
friends outside of the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 8,
2024. Youth B reported staff are always supervising the youth and
redirecting situations. She stated her best friend is Youth C and the
other boys at the facility like to make fun of both of them because of
their gender identify and sexual preference. Youth B reported the
other youth like to make up rumors about sexual things occurring
between she and Youth C. She reported she has never touched
anyone inappropriately and never had sex with someone at the
facility. Youth B reported there were rumors Youth C had sex with
someone and that was all a lie. She stated they are trying to make
them move out of the facility. Youth B reported back in the spring a
youth touched her butt when they were playing outside but nothing
further happened. She stated that it was not a big deal as that youth
left her alone after that and it may have been an accident. Youth B
denied having any relationship with Youth A and noted he is always
working. When asked if youth are allowed to go into each other’s
rooms she reported she can but the door needs to be open and staff
are always checking. She reported it can be frustrating when she
wants to have a private conversation.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 8,
2024. Youth C reported she is very frustrated with the youth at the
facility making fun of them because she is a trans. She reported no
one has touched her inappropriately but they make inappropriate
comments. Youth C reported staff will redirect but she is frustrated
with the whole situation. She reported Youth B is her best friend at
the facility. Youth C reported the boys like to make up rumors that
other people are having sex with one another, and it is not true. She
reported she knows for sure she and Youth B have never had sex at
the facility. Youth C reported youth are allowed to visit in one
another’s rooms, but the door needs to remain open and staff are
always checking in on them. She reported that can be frustrating
when she wants to have a private conversation with Youth B but
3

understands the rules. Youth C reported she has trusted staff to talk
to if she does not feel safe.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on January 18, 2024. Staff 1
reported he heard there was a sexual relationship between Youth A
and Youth B from Youth C. He reported Youth C would not go into
detail about when it occurred but noted it happened. Staff 1 reported
he has never seen anything physical going on between Youth A and
Youth B. He reported youth are allowed to go visit each other's
rooms and recently staff were told that the doors needed to be open
if a youth is visiting another youth in their room. Staff 1 reported
whenever a youth is in their room or another room, a room check
needs to occur in variable intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes and
has no concerns of staff not following this. Staff 1 reported they track
on their computer system when a room check occurs and if that
system is down then staff are to track it on paper and send it to
Supervisor 2.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 8,
2024. Staff 2 reported she has never seen concerns between Youth
A and Youth B. Staff 2 reported Youth B and Youth C have identified
as being gay and the other youth in the home make fun of them
because it is against their religion. She reported Youth A will stick up
for Youth B and Youth C. Staff 2 reported Youth A works a lot and
tries to stay out of the drama within the home. She reported the youth
are allowed to spend time with other youth in their unassigned
bedrooms. Staff 2 reported the rules are the bedroom doors need to
be open so that staff can see and hear what is going on in the rooms.
She reported room checks are done by staff in variable intervals not
to exceed fifteen minutes.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on January 18, 2024. Staff 3
reported he has been working third shift at the facility for about two
months now. He reported his main job responsibility is to take care of
the youth at the facility. He stated that he does room checks every
fifteen minutes and some of the youth get annoyed with them
checking their rooms. Staff 3 reported he tells the youth that it is his
job. He stated that he has concerns that not all the third shift staff are
performing room checks but would not state who.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on January 19, 2024. Staff 4
reported he has been working at the facility since June 2023 and he
is on third shift. He reported his primary role on third shift is to check
in on the youth to make sure they are safe. Staff 4 reported he
completes room checks every fifteen minutes but sometimes he does
checks every ten or twenty minutes. He reported that he feels the
fifteen-minute checks are too much on youth because they complain
when their door is open. Staff 4 reported he has never seen any
4

concerns or caught youth having sexual intercourse when completing
room checks. He reported he writes down on the observation log
every time he does a room check. Staff 4 reported they document on
the computer system but when it is down, they write room checks on
paper. He reported he learned how to complete room checks and
documentation when he was training and shadowing other third shift
staff.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on January 19, 2024. Staff 5
reported he previously worked at another facility for a couple of years
and started to work at this facility in November 2023. He reported
that he works on third shift and has had no concerns with the youth.
Staff 5 reported his main role is to perform room checks at night and
these checks should occur in variable intervals not to exceed fifteen
minutes. He reported every time he does a room check he needs to
note within the observation log that it was completed. Staff 5 reported
right now the process is to document it in the computer but when the
system is down staff need to document it on paper. He reported the
youth do not like the room checks and sometimes get frustrated, but
Staff 5 stated it needs to be done for their safety. Staff 5 reported
whenever a youth goes into another youth’s room at night, he walks
them to the room and stands at the door until the youth gets the item
he needs. He stated that is not a requirement but something he does
for extra supervision. Staff 5 reported he has never completed a
room check and saw the youth having sexual intercourse, but if he
did he would report it right away.
Video Footage reviewed:
The following video footage was randomly reviewed to check the
compliance of bedroom checks being completed on night shift due to
the allegations noting sexual acts were occurring in Youth A’s room.
- Video was reviewed from 12/28/2023 with the time stamp of
3am-5am. The video shows the staff completing a room check
at 3:18am, 3:31am, 3:59am, 4:31am, and 4:42am.
- Video was reviewed from 01/01/2024 with the time stamp of
1am- 2am. The video started with the staff member sitting at
the computer in the staff only area that has a view of the
youth’s bedrooms. The staff member completed one room
check during this video review at 1:23am.
Documentation Reviewed:
-Email from Law Enforcement dated 01/08/2024- Law
Enforcement reported this case was not going to be assigned for
criminal investigation.
- Email from Supervisor 2 dated 01/11/2024- Supervisor 2 reported
there is no formal policy in regard to the door needing to be open if a
youth is visiting in another youth’s room. She reported this is just
5

trained at the facility. Supervisor 2 reported there are no incident
reports involving Youth A or Youth B regarding any sexual concerns
and there were no concerns noted from their clinicians.
-Facility Policy: Staff to Resident Ratio- This policy states, “When
residents are asleep or otherwise outside of direct supervision of
staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on checks of residents.
The time between the variable interval checks shall not exceed 15
minutes. The visual checks must be electronically recorded on the
unit computer. If the electronic entry is not possible due to computer
malfunction or other circumstances, monitoring shall be done by
paper documentation.”
- Bed Check Observation Logs- Consultant reviewed bed check
logs from 12/16/23, 12/22/23, 12/27/23-1/2/24, and 1/4/24-1/12/24.
Many bed check logs are missing time frames and are exceeding
over the 15-minute bedroom check. For example, on 01/01/24 there
was only one bedroom check documented for 10:22pm. On the
observation log for 12/28/23 from 3am-5am the following bed checks
were noted at 3:10am, 3:31am, 3:32 am, 3:46 am, 3:59am, 4:18am,
4:31am, 4:42am, and 4:51am. Note this is not consistent with video
review during this time frame.
- Staff 3 HR File- Staff 3 did not have any disciplinary actions noted
with his employee file. Staff 3 has completed Orientation and
Shadow shifts to learn the responsibilities of his role and policies
associated with his role.
- Staff 4 HR File- Staff 4 did not have any disciplinary actions noted
with his employee file. Staff 4 has completed Orientation and
Shadow shifts to learn the responsibilities of his role and policies
associated with his role.
- Staff 5 HR File- Staff 5 did not have any disciplinary actions noted
with his employee file. Staff 5 has completed Orientation and
Shadow shifts to learn the responsibilities of his role and policies
associated with his role.
Analysis There is a violation found due to staff not completing room checks
in variable intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes. This was found
from interviews, video review and observation logs. During staff
interviews, some staff indicated they check on youth every 15
minutes without varying intervals. Video shows many completed
checks exceeded 15 minutes.
Consultation:
- It is recommended the description on the observation log to
be updated. The form can be confusing as it notes “On
school days visual checks begin at 9pm and continue until
6

7am the following morning. On non-school days
observation will continue until 9am.” The staff should be
completing visual checks on the youth when they are
asleep or otherwise outside of direct supervision of staff,
staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on checks of the
youth. The time between the variable interval checks shall
not exceed 15 minutes.
Technical Assistance:
- It is recommended the facility create a protocol for
requirements of supervision if a youth is hanging out in
another youth’s room such as if the door should be open,
what time of day is this allowed, and what level of supervision
is required.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & ACT 116 - 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Section conditions, books, records, and reports; access by department,
Description bureau of fire services, or local authorities; records; reports
report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of information;

(1) The department may investigate, inspect, and examine conditions
of a childcare organization and may investigate and examine the

all of the following:
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the department, and
encouraging witnesses, such as staff and household members, to
provide accurate and truthful information to the department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Third shift staff are falsifying interval checks on observation logs.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on January 18, 2024. Staff 3
reported he has been working third shift at the facility for about two
months now. He reported that he completes room checks every
fifteen minutes and will document it on the computer system. Staff 3
stated the computer system is not always working correctly and
sometimes it is down. He was asked if the system is down does he
document the checks elsewhere, and he indicated he does not.
Staff 4 and Staff 5 were interviewed separately via phone on
January 19, 2024. Both Staff 4 and Staff 5 reported on third shift all
room checks need to be documented when completed on the
observation log. They both reported if the computer system is down
7

then the room checks need to be documented on paper and given to
Supervisor 2.
Video Footage reviewed:
The following video footage was randomly reviewed to check the
compliance of bedroom checks being completed on night shift due to
the allegations noting sexual acts were occurring in Youth A’s room.
- Video was reviewed from 12/28/2023 with the time stamp of
3am-5am. The video shows the staff completing a room check
at 3:18am, 3:31am, 3:59am, 4:31am, and 4:42am. The staff
that were working on 12/28/2023 was Staff 5 and Staff 4.
Documents Reviewed:
- Bed Check Observation Log for 12/28/23 from 3am-5am-
Form notes bedroom checks were completed at 3:10am,
3:31am, 3:32 am, 3:46 am, 3:59am, 4:18am, 4:31am, 4:42am,
and 4:51am. Staff 5 was documented to be the one
completing the form.
Analysis Based on video footage and documentation reviewed, this
violation is established. The third shift staff falsified documentation
that they completed interval checks on youth, but video footage
shows they did not complete checks as documented.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
